name: vscode-keypromoter
description: Learn shortcuts while you are working

Key Promoter.enabled.markdownDescription:
**Enable the extension's keyboard shortcut detection.**

 **Why this setting exists:**
The extension monitors keyboard events to detect when you use mouse instead of shortcuts. Some antivirus software may flag this behavior as suspicious, even though:
-  All processing happens **locally** on your computer
-  **No data is collected, stored, or transmitted**
-  The extension is **fully open-source** and auditable

 **Privacy guarantee:** [Read our Privacy Policy](https://github.com/donebd/vscode-keypromoter/blob/master/PRIVACY.md)

 **If disabled:** The extension will not work - it cannot suggest shortcuts without monitoring your keyboard usage.

Key Promoter.loyaltyLevel.description: Number of command executions using mouse before notification.

Key Promoter.ignoredCommands.markdownDescription:
Specifies commands and editor patterns that will not be processed by the extension. 

**Supports wildcards:** use `*` to match any characters.

**Examples:**
- `"git.*"` - ignores all Git commands
- `"inlineChat.*"` - ignores inline chat commands
- `"editorPattern.line-delete-backspace"` - ignores specific editor tip
- `"editorPattern.*"` - ignores all editor tips

Key Promoter.suggestKeybindingCreation.description: Suggest creation of keybindings for commands without them.

Key Promoter.editorActions.enabled.markdownDescription:
**Enable smart editor action detection.**

Detects inefficient editing patterns (like deleting lines with Backspace, manual line movement, etc.) and suggests better shortcuts.

Key Promoter.editorActions.loyaltyLevel.description: Number of inefficient editor action repetitions before showing notification.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
